New Records: Australia's biggest loss by runs in the tournament history
Quinton de Kock scored 109 off 106 balls, his second consecutive World Cup century
Kagiso Rabada took key wickets including Steve Smith and Marcus Stoinis
Key Match Events: South Africa's comprehensive win by 134 runs
Poor fielding by Australia leading to several dropped catches
Turning point dismissals of Steve Smith and Marcus Stoinis through reviews
A 69-run partnership between Marnus Labuschagne (46) and Mitchell Starc (27)
Post-Match Reflections: Australia captain Pat Cummins expressed frustration over the performance
The loss leaves Australia with a 0-2 record early in the tournament
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match highlighted South Africa's dominance and Australia's struggles
Fielding errors and dismissal controversies were significant aspects
Others: Australia's need to improve their performance to avoid early exit
South Africa's strong overall performance in the match
